content:
HtmlMobileTextWriter Class

Definition

Provides text writer functionality for devices targeted by the HTML adapter set. For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the www.asp.net/mobile Web site.

In this Article

[System.Obsolete("The System.Web.Mobile.dll assembly has been deprecated and should no longer be used. For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=157231.")]
public class HtmlMobileTextWriter : System.Web.UI.MobileControls.Adapters.MobileTextWriter

Constructors

HtmlMobileTextWriter(TextWriter,MobileCapabilities)

Creates a new instance of the specified class. This API is obsolete. For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the www.asp.net/mobile Web site.

public HtmlMobileTextWriter (System.IO.TextWriter writer, System.Web.Mobile.MobileCapabilities device);
writer
TextWriter

The base writer object.

device
MobileCapabilities

An object of MobileCapabilities class that provides the capability information for the specific device.

Remarks

Adapters are usually constructed automatically by ASP.NET and must have a default constructor.

Properties

RenderBodyColor

Indicates whether the body color attribute can be sent to the output stream. This API is obsolete. For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the www.asp.net/mobile Web site.

protected bool RenderBodyColor { get; set; }
Value
Boolean

true if the body color attribute can be sent to the output stream; otherwise, false.

RenderBold

Indicates whether the bold attribute can be sent to the output stream. This API is obsolete. For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the www.asp.net/mobile Web site.

protected bool RenderBold { get; set; }
Value
Boolean

true if the bold attribute can be sent to the output stream; otherwise, false.

RenderDivAlign

Indicates whether the alignment attribute can be sent to the output stream. This API is obsolete. For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the www.asp.net/mobile Web site.

protected bool RenderDivAlign { get; set; }
Value
Boolean

true if the alignment attribute can be sent to the output stream; otherwise, false.

RenderDivNoWrap

Indicates whether the target device supports the NoWrap value for text wrapping. This API is obsolete. For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the www.asp.net/mobile Web site.

protected bool RenderDivNoWrap { get; set; }
Value
Boolean

true if the target device supports the NoWrap value for text wrapping; otherwise, false.

RenderFontColor

Indicates whether the font color attribute can be sent to the output stream. This API is obsolete. For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the www.asp.net/mobile Web site.

protected bool RenderFontColor { get; set; }
Value
Boolean

true if the font color attribute can be sent to the output stream; otherwise, false.

RenderFontName

Indicates whether the font name attribute can be sent to the output stream. This API is obsolete. For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the www.asp.net/mobile Web site.

protected bool RenderFontName { get; set; }
Value
Boolean

true if the font name attribute can be sent to the output stream; otherwise, false.

RenderFontSize

Indicates whether the font size attribute can be sent to the output stream. This API is obsolete. For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the www.asp.net/mobile Web site.

protected bool RenderFontSize { get; set; }
Value
Boolean

true if the font size attribute can be sent to the output stream; otherwise, false.

RenderItalic

Contains a Boolean value that indicates whether to send the italic attribute to the target device. This API is obsolete. For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the www.asp.net/mobile Web site.

protected bool RenderItalic { get; set; }
Value
Boolean

true if the italic attribute can be sent to the target device; otherwise, false.

RequiresNoBreakInFormatting

Gets a value indicating whether the device does not support HTML < br > elements to format line breaks. The default is false. This API is obsolete. For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the www.asp.net/mobile Web site.

protected bool RequiresNoBreakInFormatting { get; set; }
Value
Boolean

true if the device does not support HTML < br > tags; otherwise, false.

Methods

BeginStyleContext()

Starts a new Style block. This API is obsolete. For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the www.asp.net/mobile Web site.

public void BeginStyleContext ();

Remarks

Use the EndStyleContext method to complete the Style block.

EndStyleContext()

Completes a new Style block. This API is obsolete. For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the www.asp.net/mobile Web site.

public void EndStyleContext ();

Remarks

Use the BeginStyleContext method to start the Style block.

EnterFormat(Style)

Begins a block by using the character formatting from a specified style. This API is obsolete. For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the www.asp.net/mobile Web site.

public override void EnterFormat (System.Web.UI.MobileControls.Style style);
style
Style

The style reference.

EnterLayout(Style)

Begins a block by using the layout and character formatting from a given style. This API is obsolete. For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the www.asp.net/mobile Web site.

public override void EnterLayout (System.Web.UI.MobileControls.Style style);
style
Style

The style reference.

EnterStyle(Style)

Begins a block by using the layout and character formatting from a given style. This API is obsolete. For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the www.asp.net/mobile Web site.

public void EnterStyle (System.Web.UI.MobileControls.Style style);
style
Style

The style reference.

Remarks

The EnterStyle and ExitStyle methods allow a device adapter to emit markup, in order to begin and end a block using the character formatting from a given style.

ExitFormat(Style)

Ends a block that has been using the character formatting from a specified style. This API is obsolete. For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the www.asp.net/mobile Web site.

public override void ExitFormat (System.Web.UI.MobileControls.Style style);
style
Style

The style reference.

ExitFormat(Style,Boolean)

Ends a block that has been using the character formatting from a specified style. This API is obsolete. For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the www.asp.net/mobile Web site.

public override void ExitFormat (System.Web.UI.MobileControls.Style style, bool breakAfter);
style
Style

The style reference.

breakAfter
Boolean

If breakAfter is true, a break is added after the closing style element.

ExitLayout(Style)

Removes the current style, restores the previous style as the current layout style, and optionally calls the stem.Web.UI.MobileControls.Adapters.XhtmlAdapters.XhtmlMobileTextWriter.WriteEndTag* method to close the current element. This API is obsolete. For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the www.asp.net/mobile Web site.

The style reference.

Removes the current style, restores the previous style as the current layout style, and optionally calls the stem.Web.UI.MobileControls.Adapters.XhtmlAdapters.XhtmlMobileTextWriter.WriteEndTag* method to close the current element. This API is obsolete. For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the www.asp.net/mobile Web site.

style

The style reference.

breakAfter
Boolean

Ends a block that has been using the layout and character formatting from a given style. This API is obsolete. For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the www.asp.net/mobile Web site.

The style reference.

MarkStyleContext()

Marks the beginning of a style context. This API is obsolete. For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the www.asp.net/mobile Web site.

protected void MarkStyleContext ();

UnMarkStyleContext()

Closes a style context. This API is obsolete. For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the www.asp.net/mobile Web site.

protected void UnMarkStyleContext ();

Write(Char)

Writes the given character to the output stream. This API is obsolete. For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the www.asp.net/mobile Web site.

public override void Write (char c);
c
Char

The character to write to the output stream.

Write(String)

Writes the text to the output stream, along with any pending tab spacing. This API is obsolete. For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the www.asp.net/mobile Web site.

public override void Write (string text);
text
String

The text to write to the output stream.

WriteBeginTag(String)

Writes any tab spacing and the opening tag of the specified markup element to the output stream. This API is obsolete. For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the www.asp.net/mobile Web site.

public override void WriteBeginTag (string tag);
tag
String

None

WriteBreak()

Writes a line break. This API is obsolete. For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the www.asp.net/mobile Web site.

public void WriteBreak ();

WriteEncodedText(String)

Encodes the specified text for the requesting device, and then writes it to the output stream. This API is obsolete. For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the www.asp.net/mobile Web site.

public override void WriteEncodedText (string text);
text
String

The text to encode and write to the output stream.

WriteFullBeginTag(String)

Writes any tab spacing and the opening tag of the specified markup element to the output stream. This API is obsolete. For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the www.asp.net/mobile Web site.

public override void WriteFullBeginTag (string tag);
tag
String

None

WriteHiddenField(String,String)

Writes a hidden field with the given name and value. This API is obsolete. For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the www.asp.net/mobile Web site.

public void WriteHiddenField (string name, string value);
name
String

The name of the hidden field.

value
String

The value of the hidden field.

Remarks

A hidden field is in the form <input type="hidden" name="name" value="value">.

WriteLine(String)

Writes a line terminator string to the output stream. This API is obsolete. For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the www.asp.net/mobile Web site.

public override void WriteLine (string text);
text
String

The line terminator string to write.

WriteText(String,Boolean)

Writes the given text, optionally with encoding. This API is obsolete. For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the www.asp.net/mobile Web site.

public void WriteText (string text, bool encodeText);
text
String

The text to write.

encodeText
Boolean

If true, encodes the text.

Remarks

Encoding involves mapping characters with HTML/WML meanings to the appropriate character code.

WriteUrlParameter(String,String)

Writes an encoded URL parameter. This API is obsolete. For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the www.asp.net/mobile Web site.

public void WriteUrlParameter (string name, string value);
name
String

The parameter name to encode and write.

value
String

The parameter value to encode and write.

Remarks

The parameter is written in the form name=value.
